Singapore is betting roughly $10 billion on a mega-terminal so vast, it requires reclaiming new land from the sea. Its airport is competing with the world’s largest hubs—from Dubai to Hong Kong to Bangkok. Now, they want to build a 5th terminal designed to operate during future pandemics, powered by massive solar roofs, and linked by tunnels drilled beneath an active runway.
